pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā nando bhagavato mātucchāputto abhirūpo hoti dassanīyo pāsādiko caturaṅgulomako bhagavatā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.2.eng: At that time there was a handsome and graceful monk called Venerable Nanda, the Buddha’s cousin. He was seven centimeters shorter than the Buddha,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.2.comm: That is, four fingerbreadths. For a discussion of the aṅgula, see sugata in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.3.eng: but he wore a robe that was the same size as the Buddha’s.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.3.comm: Here I render sugata as “Buddha”, which seems required by the narrative. I do not think, however, that this narrative usage ties our hands in the interpretation of this term. See below.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.4.pli: Addasaṃsu kho therā bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ nandaṃ dūratova āgacchantaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.4.eng: When the senior monks saw him coming,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.6.eng: they thought it was the Buddha and got up from their seats.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.7.pli: Te upagate jānitvā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.7.eng: But when he came close, they realized who it was, and they complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā nando sugatacīvarappamāṇaṃ cīvaraṃ dhāressatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.8.eng: “How can Venerable Nanda wear a robe the same size as the Buddha’s?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.9.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, nanda, sugatacīvarappamāṇaṃ cīvaraṃ dhāresī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.9.eng: “Is it true, Nanda, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.12.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, nanda, sugatacīvarappamāṇaṃ cīvaraṃ dhāressasi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.14.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.14.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.15.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu sugatacīvarappamāṇaṃ cīvaraṃ kārāpeyya atirekaṃ vā, chedanakaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.15.1.eng: ‘If a monk has a robe made that is the standard robe size or larger, it is to be cut down, and he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.15.1.comm: For an explanation of rendering sugata as “standard”, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.16.pli: Tatridaṃ sugatassa sugatacīvarappamāṇaṃ—dīghaso nava vidatthiyo, sugatavidatthiyā; tiriyaṃ cha vidatthiyo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.16.eng: This is the standard robe size: nine standard handspans long and six wide.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.6.pli: dīghaso nava vidatthiyo, sugatavidatthiyā; tiriyaṃ cha vidatthiyo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.6.eng: nine standard handspans long and six wide.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.8.pli: karoti vā kārāpeti vā, payoge dukkaṭaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.8.eng: if he makes one or has one made, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.9.eng: When he gets it, it is to be cut down, and he is then to confess an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.10.1.pli: Attanā vippakataṃ attanā pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.10.1.eng: If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.11.pli: Attanā vippakataṃ parehi pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.11.eng: If he has others finish what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.12.pli: Parehi vippakataṃ attanā pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.12.eng: If he finishes himself what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.13.pli: Parehi vippakataṃ parehi pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.13.eng: If he has others finish what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.14.pli: Aññassatthāya karoti vā kārāpeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.14.eng: If he makes one or has one made for the benefit of someone else, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.15.pli: Aññena kataṃ paṭilabhitvā paribhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.1.15.eng: If he gets one that was made by someone else and then uses it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.2.2.eng: if he makes it smaller than the standard robe;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.2.3.eng: if he gets one made by another that is too large and then cuts it down before using it;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.2.4.pli: vitānaṃ vā bhūmattharaṇaṃ vā sāṇipākāraṃ vā bhisiṃ vā bibbohanaṃ vā karoti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.2.4.eng: if he makes a canopy, a floor cover, a cloth screen, a mattress, or a pillow;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.2.6.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.2.7.eng: The training rule on Nanda, the tenth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.2.8.eng: The ninth subchapter on precious things is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.2.14.pli: Uddiṭṭhā kho, āyasmanto, dvenavuti pācittiyā dhammā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.2.14.eng: “Venerables, the ninety-two rules on confession have been recited.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.2.15.eng: In regard to this I ask you,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.2.21.eng: You are pure in this and therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.2.22.eng: The section on minor rules has been completed.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:2.2.23.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing acknowledgment

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:0.4.eng: The first training rule on acknowledgment

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:0.5.pli: Ime kho panāyasmanto cattāro pāṭidesanīyā dhammā uddesaṃ āgacchanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:0.5.eng: Venerables, these four rules on acknowledgment come up for recitation.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā bhikkhunī sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya caritvā paṭikkamanakāle aññataraṃ bhikkhuṃ passitvā etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.2.eng: a certain nun was returning from almsround in Sāvatthī. She saw a monk and said to him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.5.pli: Sā upakaṭṭhe kāle nāsakkhi piṇḍāya carituṃ, chinnabhattā ahosi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.5.eng: But because the time for eating was coming to an end, she was not able to go for alms, and she missed her meal.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.6.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī dutiyampi divasaṃ …pe…

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.7.pli: tatiyampi divasaṃ sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya caritvā paṭikkamanakāle taṃ bhikkhuṃ passitvā etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.7.eng: and the following day the same thing happened again.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.10.pli: Sā upakaṭṭhe kāle nāsakkhi piṇḍāya carituṃ, chinnabhattā ahosi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.11.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī catutthe divase rathikāya pavedhentī gacchati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.11.eng: On the fourth day that nun was walking along a street, trembling.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.12.pli: Seṭṭhi gahapati rathena paṭipathaṃ āgacchanto taṃ bhikkhuniṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.12.eng: A wealthy merchant coming by carriage in the opposite direction saw her and shouted out,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.14.eng: As she stepped aside, she collapsed right there.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.15.eng: The merchant asked her for forgiveness:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.16.eng: “Forgive me, venerable, since you fell because of me.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.20.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī seṭṭhissa gahapatissa etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.20.eng: The nun told him what had happened.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.21.pli: Seṭṭhi gahapati taṃ bhikkhuniṃ gharaṃ netvā bhojetvā ujjhāyati khiyyati vipāceti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.21.eng: He then brought her to his house and gave her a meal. Afterwards he complained and criticized the monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.22.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhadantā bhikkhuniyā hatthato āmisaṃ paṭiggahessanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.22.eng: “How can the venerables receive food directly from a nun?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.23.eng: It’s difficult for women to get material support.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.24.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tassa seṭṭhissa gahapatissa ujjhāyantassa khiyyantassa vipācentassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.24.eng: The monks heard the complaints of that merchant,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.25.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.25.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized that monk,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.26.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhu bhikkhuniyā hatthato āmisaṃ paṭiggahessatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.26.eng: “How could a monk receive food directly from a nun?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.27.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, bhikkhu, bhikkhuniyā hatthato āmisaṃ paṭiggahesī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.27.eng: “Is it true, monk, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.31.pli: “Aññātako, moghapurisa, aññātikāya na jānāti patirūpaṃ vā appatirūpaṃ vā santaṃ vā asantaṃ vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.31.eng: “Foolish man, a man and a woman who are unrelated don’t know what’s appropriate and inappropriate, what’s good and bad, in dealing with each other.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.32.pli: Kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā hatthato āmisaṃ paṭiggahessasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.32.eng: So how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.34.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.34.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.35.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā antaragharaṃ paviṭṭhāya hatthato khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khādeyya vā bhuñjeyya vā, paṭidesetabbaṃ tena bhikkhunā—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.35.1.eng: ‘If a monk receives fresh or cooked food directly from an unrelated nun who has entered an inhabited area, and then eats it, he must acknowledge it:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.36.pli: ‘gārayhaṃ, āvuso, dhammaṃ āpajjiṃ asappāyaṃ pāṭidesanīyaṃ, taṃ paṭidesemī’”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:1.36.eng: “I have done a blameworthy and unsuitable thing that is to be acknowledged. I acknowledge it.”’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.1.6.pli: mātito vā pitito vā yāva sattamā pitāmahayugā asambaddhā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.1.6.eng: anyone who is not a descendant of one’s male ancestors going back eight generations, either on the mother’s side or on the father’s side.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.1.6.comm: Sp 1.505: Tattha yāva sattamā pitāmahayugāti pitupitā pitāmaho, pitāmahassa yugaṁ pitāmahayugaṁ, “In this yāva sattamā pitāmahayuga means: the father of a father is a grandfather. The generation of a grandfather is called a pitāmahayuga.” So the PaIi phrase yāva sattamā pitāmahayuga means “as far as the seventh generation of grandfathers”, that is, eight generations back. This can be counted as follows: (1) one’s grandfather; (2) his father; (3) 2’s father; (4) 3’s father; (5) 4’s father; (6) 5’s father; and (7) 6’s father. This applies to both one’s paternal and maternal grandfathers. This gives a total of 14 ancestors. Anyone who is a descendent of these fourteen is considered a relative. Anyone who is not such a descendent is not regarded as a relative.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.1.8.eng: she has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.1.10.eng: a street, a cul-de-sac, an intersection, a house.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.1.12.pli: pañca bhojanāni yāmakālikaṃ sattāhakālikaṃ yāvajīvikaṃ ṭhapetvā avasesaṃ khādanīyaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.1.12.eng: apart from the five cooked foods, the post-midday tonics, the seven-day tonics, and the lifetime tonics, the rest is called “fresh food”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.1.14.pli: pañca bhojanāni—odano, kummāso, sattu, maccho, maṃsaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.1.14.eng: there are five kinds of cooked food: cooked grain, porridge, flour products, fish, and meat.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.1.14.comm: “Flour products” renders sattu. See discussion in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.1.15.eng: If he receives the food with the intention of eating it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.1.16.eng: For every mouthful swallowed, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.2.1.pli: Aññātikāya aññātikasaññī antaragharaṃ paviṭṭhāya hatthato khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khādati vā bhuñjati vā, āpatti pāṭidesanīyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.2.1.eng: If she is unrelated and he perceives her as such, and he receives fresh or cooked food directly from her when she has entered an inhabited area, and then eats it, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.2.2.pli: Aññātikāya vematiko antaragharaṃ paviṭṭhāya hatthato khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khādati vā bhuñjati vā, āpatti pāṭidesanīyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.2.2.eng: If she is unrelated, but he is unsure of it, and he receives fresh or cooked food directly from her when she has entered an inhabited area, and then eats it, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.2.3.pli: Aññātikāya ñātikasaññī antaragharaṃ paviṭṭhāya hatthato khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā khādati vā bhuñjati vā, āpatti pāṭidesanīyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.2.3.eng: If she is unrelated, but he perceives her as related, and he receives fresh or cooked food directly from her when she has entered an inhabited area, and then eats it, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.2.4.pli: Yāmakālikaṃ sattāhakālikaṃ yāvajīvikaṃ āhāratthāya paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.2.4.eng: If he receives post-midday tonics, seven-day tonics, or lifetime tonics for the purpose of food, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.2.5.eng: For every mouthful swallowed, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.2.6.pli: Ekatoupasampannāya hatthato khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.2.6.eng: If he receives fresh or cooked food, with the intention of eating it, directly from a nun who is fully ordained only on one side,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.2.7.eng: he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.2.8.eng: For every mouthful swallowed, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.2.9.eng: If she is related, but he perceives her as unrelated, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.2.10.eng: If she is related, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.2.11.eng: If she is related, and he perceives her as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.3.3.eng: if she gets someone else to give it and does not give it herself;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.3.4.eng: if she gives by placing it near;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.3.5.eng: if it is inside a monastery;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.3.6.eng: if it is at the dwelling place of nuns;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.3.7.eng: if it is at the dwelling place of the monastics of another religion;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.3.8.eng: if it is on returning to the monastery;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.3.9.eng: if she gives after carrying it out of the village;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.3.10.pli: yāmakālikaṃ sattāhakālikaṃ yāvajīvikaṃ “sati paccaye paribhuñjā”ti deti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.3.10.eng: if she gives post-midday tonics, seven-day tonics, or lifetime tonics, saying, “Use these when there’s a reason;”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.3.11.eng: if it is a trainee nun;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.3.12.eng: if it is a novice nun;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.3.14.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd1:2.3.15.eng: The first training rule on acknowledgment is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing acknowledgment

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:0.4.eng: The second training rule on acknowledgment

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū kulesu nimantitā bhuñjanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.2.eng: At that time, when families invited monks to meals,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.3.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo chabbaggiyānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ vosāsantiyo ṭhitā honti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.3.eng: the nuns from the group of six were directing people toward the monks from the group of six, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.5.eng: The monks from the group of six ate as much as they wanted,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.6.eng: but not so the other monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.7.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.7.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo vosāsantiyo na nivāressantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.8.eng: “How could the monks from the group of six not restrain the nuns from giving directions?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.9.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo vosāsantiyo na nivārethā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.9.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you didn’t do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.12.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, bhikkhuniyo vosāsantiyo na nivāressatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.12.eng: “Foolish men, how could you not do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.14.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.14.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.15.1.pli: “Bhikkhū paneva kulesu nimantitā bhuñjanti, tatra ce sā bhikkhunī vosāsamānarūpā ṭhitā hoti—‘idha sūpaṃ detha, idha odanaṃ dethā’ti, tehi bhikkhūhi sā bhikkhunī apasādetabbā— ‘apasakka tāva, bhagini, yāva bhikkhū bhuñjantī’ti. Ekassa cepi bhikkhuno na paṭibhāseyya taṃ bhikkhuniṃ apasādetuṃ— ‘apasakka tāva, bhagini, yāva bhikkhū bhuñjantī’ti paṭidesetabbaṃ tehi bhikkhūhi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.15.1.eng: ‘When monks eat by invitation to families, if a nun is there giving directions, saying, “Give bean curry here; give rice there,” then those monks should stop her: “Stop, Sister, while the monks are eating.” If not even a single monk addresses that nun in this way to stop her, they must acknowledge it:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.16.pli: ‘gārayhaṃ, āvuso, dhammaṃ āpajjimhā asappāyaṃ pāṭidesanīyaṃ, taṃ paṭidesemā’”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.16.eng: “We have done a blameworthy and unsuitable thing which is to be acknowledged. We acknowledge it.”’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.1.eng: When monks eat by invitation to families:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.2.pli: kulaṃ nāma cattāri kulāni— khattiyakulaṃ, brāhmaṇakulaṃ, vessakulaṃ, suddakulaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.2.eng: a family: there are four kinds of families: the aristocratic family, the brahmin family, the merchant family, the worker family.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.4.pli: pañcannaṃ bhojanānaṃ aññatarena bhojanena nimantitā bhuñjanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.4.eng: eat any of the five cooked foods by invitation.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.6.eng: she has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.8.pli: yathāmittatā yathāsandiṭṭhatā yathāsambhattatā yathāsamānupajjhāyakatā yathāsamānācariyakatā— “idha sūpaṃ detha, idha odanaṃ dethā”ti. Esā vosāsantī nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.8.eng: saying, “Give bean curry here; give rice there,” according to friendship, according to companionship, according to who one is devoted to, according to being a co-student, according to being a co-pupil—this is called “giving directions”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.12.eng: the nun who is giving directions.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.13.pli: Tehi bhikkhūhi sā bhikkhunī apasādetabbā— “apasakka tāva, bhagini, yāva bhikkhū bhuñjantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.13.eng: Those monks should stop her: ‘Stop, Sister, while the monks are eating’:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.14.pli: Ekassa cepi bhikkhuno anapasādito— “khādissāmi bhuñjissāmī”ti paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.14.eng: if she is not stopped by even one monk, and a monk then receives food with the intention of eating it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.14.comm: Khādissāmi bhuñjissāmi, which would normally refer to both fresh and cooked food. But since fresh food is explicitly excluded, both above and below, it would seem that in this context even khādissāmi refers to eating cooked food.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.15.eng: For every mouthful swallowed, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.2.1.pli: Upasampannāya upasampannasaññī vosāsantiyā na nivāreti, āpatti pāṭidesanīyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.2.1.eng: If she is fully ordained, and he perceives her as such, and he does not restrain her from giving directions, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.2.2.pli: Upasampannāya vematiko vosāsantiyā na nivāreti, āpatti pāṭidesanīyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.2.2.eng: If she is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, and he does not restrain her from giving directions, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.2.3.pli: Upasampannāya anupasampannasaññī vosāsantiyā na nivāreti, āpatti pāṭidesanīyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.2.3.eng: If she is fully ordained, but he does not perceive her as such, and he does not restrain her from giving directions, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.2.4.pli: Ekatoupasampannāya vosāsantiyā na nivāreti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.2.4.eng: If he does not restrain a nun who is fully ordained only on one side from giving directions, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.2.5.eng: If the person is not fully ordained, but he perceives them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.2.6.eng: If the person is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.2.7.eng: If the person is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive them as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.2.eng: if a nun does not give it herself, but gets someone else to give her own food;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.3.eng: if a nun does not get someone else to give it, but she gives someone else’s food herself;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.4.eng: if a nun gets someone else to give what has not yet been given;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.5.eng: if a nun gets someone else to give to someone who has not yet received anything;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.6.eng: if a nun gets someone else to give equally to all;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.7.eng: if a trainee nun is giving directions;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.8.eng: if a novice nun is giving directions;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.9.eng: if it is anything apart from the five kinds of cooked food;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.11.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.12.eng: The second training rule on acknowledgment is finished.
